Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the B.Ed exam on the increase in COVID-19 cases by stating that the number of cases sharply jumped after the exam.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the student tested positive for COVID-19 due to the B.Ed exam.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of following standard operating procedures (SOPs) during the B.Ed exam led to the student testing positive for COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the student testing positive for COVID-19, such as exposure to the virus from other sources or community transmission.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the National Examination Agency has clarified that the NEET and JEE exams will be held as scheduled, suggesting that the exams were not postponed due to the student's condition.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in providing accurate information about the student's condition and the circumstances surrounding the B.Ed exam.
